longBusinessSummary: Cantabio Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a preclinical stage biotechnology company, focuses on the research, development, and commercialization of novel therapies for Parkinson's disease (PD), Alzheimer's disease (AD), and other related diseases. Its lead programs include CB101, a DJ-1 targeting small molecule pharmacological chaperone for use in the treatment of PD; CB201, a CNS penetrant engineered DJ-1 protein for use in the treatment of PD; CB301, a Tau protein targeting small molecule pharmacological chaperone for use in the treatment of AD; and CB401, an Aß targeting small molecule pharmacological chaperone for use in the treatment of AD. The company has a collaboration agreement with Luxembourg Institute of Health to research the therapeutic targeting of the DJ-1 - protein to treat immune associated diseases. The company was founded in 2009 and is based in Palo Alto, California.
